channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8946] Add a new function to Thrift 2 to open scanner, get results and close scanner
item.description:
We found, very often we open a scanner , get x number of rows , then close the scanner immediately. The attached patch , add a new function getScannerResults that does just that.

Using getScannerResults function reduce number of calls to thrift server. Also since the scanner gets closed immediately, it is less prone to cause memory leak.
item.summary: Add a new function to Thrift 2 to open scanner, get results and close scanner

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Lars George The attached patch also reformat code style in ThriftHBaseServiceHandler to wrap lines longer than 100 characters. If this is approved, I can make the patch for 0.94.

+1 on the idea. Is this not in thrift1? If not, our bad because we had something like this at the place where I used to work.
Hey Hamed Madani, could you update the patch based on the latest trunk? It fails for me now.
Stack, I did not see it. The "scannerGet{List}()" are for an open scanner to get the next (or next N) row(s).
Elliott Clark or Jean-Daniel Cryans – we never upstreamed this hack done at SU?
This has most of it https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12582397/HBASE-3852-0.94.patch, it's just missing scan and scanMore.
Updated the patch Lars George,let me know if this looks good , I can make the 0.94 then
Hi Hamed Madani, did you forget to include the generated files? The patch only touches the static files. I can generate, but as before you should include them if you can? Thanks!
Hamed Madani, could you check with the patch JD linked to, if that is covered by your patch? Should we add what is missing (if there is anything missing)?

Sorry Hamed Madani, just check Jean-Daniel Cryans link and it is the one from HBASE-3852, which is still open. That patch only has the Thrift scanner leak code in it, not the scan and scanMore he is referring to, so please disregard my last comment. Hey Jean-Daniel Cryans, could you have a quick looksee here if Hamed's patch is covering what you had internally?
Lars, This patch does include the generated file THBaseService.java which is the only generated file that has changed.

Sorry, my bad (too late for me here)

One nit, could you extend the test to scan three times, with 5, 10, and 20 rows? Just to check they return 5, 10 and 10 as expected per the test rows?

Also, for some reason the patch does not apply to 0.95, there seems to be a class that is different to trunk. Would you be able to have a look too?

For some reason ThriftHBaseServiceHandler.java is different in 0.95, i.e. it is lacking some formatting updates. Let me bring them to the same level and commit that as part of the patch. In other words, never mind about a 0.95 patch, the trunk one will apply.
Great. I am double checking the new patch with the additional tests you mentioned.

Updated the patch with extended test. Also removed the following line from hbase.thrift closeScanner 


* Exhausted scanners are closed automatically.

This message is automatically generated.

Wait...

* Exhausted scanners are closed automatically.

This actually relates to HBASE-8852. Come to think of it, it seems to be a good idea to reopen the discussion on this. I mean, if we were to close and release the scanners when they exhausted, it would save an additional RPC call. But then what about loops where you do not know you are at the end? I think what we have now, with your addition, and the true open + get + close calls we should be good. If we then add HBASE-3852 to take care of those where the user choses path C, i.e. open + get but without a close, we should be good. Any opinions?

As for the test, we should also add 


    try {

      // close scanner and check that it was indeed closed

      handler.closeScanner(scanId);

      fail("Scanner id should be invalid");

    } catch (TIllegalArgument e) {

    }

to check that the scanner is indeed closed implicitly.

As for the comment, maybe change it to

  /**

   * Closes the scanner. Should be called to free server side resources timely. 

   * Typically close once the scanner is not needed anymore, i.e. after looping

   * over it to get all the required rows.

   */

Makes sense? I am a friend of good and explanatory commenting

Otherwise the patch and test apply and run fine, if you could put those final touches on it Hamed Madani, that would be great! And a patch for 0.94 at the same time? Appreciated

The function never returns scanId, it simply returns the results , so I'm not sure what I should use in place of scanId in


 try {

      // close scanner and check that it was indeed closed

      handler.closeScanner(scanId);   <----------------------- scanId is undefined

      fail("Scanner id should be invalid");

    } catch (TIllegalArgument e) {

    }

regarding HBASE-3852, as you mentioned the only time user benefits from closing the scanner when it's exhausted, is when the user knows exactly how many rows the scanner suppose to return, but doesn't want to get all the results in one call (i.e doesn't want to use scannerGetResults). I'm not sure if such a use case exists and justifies an additional if statement to all the scanner calls, but I could be wrong
I actually meant HBASE-8852 and not HBASE-3852 in my previous comment.

I uploaded the new patch with modified comment for closeScanner. I was not sure how to address your last comment about the test Lars George. As I mentioned scanId is an undefined value with getScannerResults function. However, if I'm still missing something please let me know before making 0.94 patch
